message: Hi everyone, I am in desperate need of your help to spread the word. I am outraged as a UI designer by the recent competition held by Skype, and would like to get those of you who share my point of view to let others know, for the love of what we do. More details in my blog post http://kaishinlab.com/no-to-skype-competition/

That's the best they can do for prizes? Really! Talk about No Spec. It's one thing when small businesses do it. It's just plain annoying with a huge as corporation as Skype does it. They think it's 'cool'.
It's really sad to see hordes of designers actually falling for it. It gives more excuses to others to deliver mediocrity and expect 'enthusiastic' designers to fix it.
when i came across this i thought to myself , why skype why do this .... its a no go zone for such a big corporation .
Customization is one thing, fixing your UI for free is another.
What's even funnier is the twist they gave it...
The payment on this one is having your name of the Skype design.
@emperorcezar sure, they all say this. I'm afraid but having my name on th credits roll won't pay my bill.
@emperorcezar some might say that would bring me more clients, but mind you that ifwe keep playing this contest/crowdsourcing game, no one will be willing to pay for design...

Interesting debate as design competitions are rather common in other fields of design such as industrial design. My brother happens to be an industrial designer and competitions are a great way to get credit and visibility (if you're good). I totally agree that this isn't the right way for Skype to fix their errors with the new client but don't see the concept as that bad in general for newcomers.
btw. submitted this to HackerNews, more comments there: http://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=2406328
have any of you guys meet the angry nerds? http://www.atlassian.com/en/angrynerds - although it's developer heavy, kinda apply here :)
@tyrale It can be very much so. Many people do work for big companies, in many fields, to get their name on it. You may not do it for that payment, doesn't mean others won't.

@kaishin Contests like this have gone on in other fields for a very long time. Decades. People still pay for work in those fields. Only a few big places can get away with a contest and get something reasonable out of it.
